skill.name: analyzing-projects
skill.description: Analyzes codebases to understand structure, tech stack, patterns, and conventions. Use when onboarding to a new project, exploring unfamiliar code, or when asked "how does this work?" or "what's the architecture?"
skill.summary: Analyzes codebases to understand structure, tech stack, patterns, and conventions. Use when onboardi...
skill.author: CloudAI-X

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It provides a systematic workflow and checklist for analyzing codebases. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Understanding unfamiliar codebases is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides a systematic workflow to quickly analyze project structure, tech stack, and architecture patterns.
actual_capabilities: Detects programming languages and frameworks from config files
Identifies project structure patterns and conventions
Maps key directories and their purposes
limitations: Requires existing project files to analyze
Cannot analyze compiled or minified code
Does not execute or test the code

use_cases.title: Quick Project Onboarding
use_cases.description: Analyze unfamiliar codebases to understand structure, tech stack, and development patterns when joining a new team.

use_cases.title: Code Review Preparation
use_cases.description: Systematically analyze pull requests to understand architectural changes and their impact on the project.

use_cases.title: Legacy Code Understanding
use_cases.description: Explore and document old or poorly documented codebases to plan refactoring and modernization efforts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Project Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase and provide a comprehensive overview including tech stack, architecture patterns, and project structure.

prompt_templates.title: Tech Stack Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: What technologies and frameworks are used in this project? Check package files, config files, and directory structure.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map out the architecture of this project. Show how components interact and identify key patterns used.

prompt_templates.title: Development Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the development workflow. Find build scripts, test commands, linting setup, and deployment configurations.

output: - npm run dev - Start development server

best_practices: Follow the 6-step workflow systematically for consistent results
Verify findings with actual file contents before making assumptions
Document unclear areas as 'needs clarification' rather than guessing
Use the provided templates to ensure comprehensive coverage
anti_patterns: Skipping steps in the analysis workflow
Making assumptions without checking actual files
Ignoring configuration files and build scripts
Not validating findings against the actual codebase

faq.question: What types of projects can this analyze?
faq.answer: Any software project with standard structure - web apps, APIs, libraries, microservices. Works with all major languages and frameworks.

faq.question: How long does a typical analysis take?
faq.answer: 2-5 minutes for most projects. Larger codebases may take longer. The workflow helps focus on the most important aspects first.

faq.question: Can it analyze private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have local access to the code. The skill works with any accessible directory on your system.

faq.question: What if the project doesn't follow standard conventions?
faq.answer: The skill adapts to find patterns even in unconventional projects. Document any unclear areas for follow-up investigation.

faq.question: Does it modify or execute any code?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only analysis tool. It only examines files without making changes or running anything.

faq.question: How accurate is the tech stack detection?
faq.answer: Very accurate for standard projects. Checks multiple indicators like package files, config files, and import statements.
